column9: Description
column10: Acceptance Criteria

column9:
As an engineer
I want establish a scalable baseline platofrm in a single code base
so that we can quickly and efficiently stand up new events
column10:
• Baseline admin capabilities functionally equivalent to RRS
• Multi event support that meets the needs of MSR India with a scalable baseline platform

column9:
As an admin
I want to create event sections with core pages
so that I can launch MSR India and future programs
column10:
• Admin can create hub sections (home, about, agenda)
• Set permissions for hub/event/session (if applicable)

column9:
As an admin
I want to add/update sessions with required data
so that the agenda stays accurate pre- and post-event
column10:
• Fields: title, abstract, speakers, date/time, duration, location, links
• Toggle for Before vs After state

column9:
As an admin
I want to add/update posters with structured fields
so that the hub displays consistent assets
column10:
• Supports poster entity fields (core identity, event context, people/contact, related links)
• Bulk import optional

column9:
As an organizer
I want to review and validate content before publishing
so that data quality remains high
column10:
• Workflow: Draft ? Review ? Published
• Audit trail of changes

column9:
As an attendee
I want to see a list of upcoming and current MSR events on the homepage
so that I can quickly navigate to the event I care about.
column10:
• Homepage displays the following events with title, date/time, location (if available), and a "View event" CTA
•	Redmond Research Showcase
•	MSR India TAB
•	Project Green
•	Cambridge Research Showcase
•	MSR East: TBD
•	MSR Asia TAB (pending future discussions)
•	Lecture series: Whiteboard Wednesdays, AI & Society Fellows, Leaders @ Microsoft
• For events not hosted on the hub yet, the CTA links to an external event site

column9:
As an organizer
I can create and publish new event sites on the hub
so they appear on the homepage
column10:
• Card fields: name, dates, optional tracks/themes 
• Cards render consistently across desktop / mobile
* Admin can add event metadata and homepage updates automatically

column9:
As an attendee
I want an event-specific home page modeled after RRS
so that I can orient and access key sections
column10: • Hero + quick links (About, Agenda, Posters, Sessions)

column9:
As an attendee
I want an About page with logistics
so that I know the purpose, venue, and how to attend
column10:
• Overview, venue, dates/times, registration/Teams link (pre-event), embedded talk (after-event)
• Map/address block, if in-person

column9:
As an attendee
I want to browse a multi-day agenda filtered by tracks or themes
so that I can find sessions relevant to me
column10:
• Multi-day agendas
• Filter by tracks/themes
• Session data includes title, abstract preview, speaker(s), date/time, duration, location, links to decks, related papers, repos, etc.

column9:
As an attendee
I want a session detail page
so that I can watch the recording and access related assets
column10:
• Generate subpage from agenda data
• Before: Teams link + date/time/location
• After: embedded recording
• Related assets: decks, papers, repos

column9:
As an attendee
I want a poster hub page with optional themes
so that I can browse posters by area of interest
column10:
• List all posters
• Optional theme grouping (RRS model)

column9:
As an attendee
I want visually scannable poster tiles
so that I can quickly decide what to open
column10:
• Tile includes title, theme/track, thumbnail, team preview
• Click opens project detail

column9:
As a presenter
I want a structured project detail page
so that our research is represented with high-quality digital assets
column10:
• Required: title, abstract, team list (name, title, image, email), contact
• Optional: image, embedded video
• Links: repos, decks, papers, project sites

column9:
As an attendee
I want to locate posters within the venue
so that I can plan my route during the event
column10:
• Location field supports room/booth/floor
• Search/browse by area/title/location

column9:
As an organizer
I want auto-generated QR codes for each project
so that attendees can bookmark quickly at the poster
column10:
• Assign human-readable project IDs
• QR resolves to project detail page

column9:
As an attendee
I want to scan a poster's QR code and add it to my bookmarks
so that I can revisit it post-event
column10:
• Scan creates bookmark
• Confirmation toast/state change

column9:
As an atendee
I want a personal list of bookmarked projects
so that I can follow up after the event
column10:
• 'My Bookmarks' page
• Quick links to repos, papers, contacts

column9:
As a product owner
I want metrics on pre-event visits
so that we can measure early planning behavior
column10: • Report: % registered/expected attendees visiting before Day 1

column9:
As a product owner
I want post-event traffic metrics
so that we can gauge durability of content
column10: • Report: % of promoted audience visiting within 7/30 days

column9:
As a product owner
I want geo/time-zone reach metrics
so that we can validate value beyond live attendance
column10: • Report: % unique users outside primary geo/time zone

column9:
As a product owner
I want to track follow-up actions
so that we can measure collaboration sparks
column10: • Count email/contact clicks, repo visits, asset downloads

column9:
As a product owner
I want to ensure that we have metrics captured on all pages in the app
so that we can measure engagement
column10: • 1DS code is present and working

column9:
As a program owner
I want platform adoption metrics
so that we can aim for default usage across MSR
column10:
• Events onboarded/quarter
• Repeat program usage %
• Organizer self-service rate
• Post-event content usage %
• Cross-event engagement %

column9:
As a presenter
I want to upload a poster PDF and receive suggested abstract edits
so that our summary is clear and consistent
column10:
• Upload triggers AI suggestions
• Presenter approves/modifies

column9:
As an attendee
I want a simple chat based on abstracts
so that I can explore research at a high level
column10:
• Q&A constrained to published abstracts/metadata
• Labeled 'beta'
